datafield.subfield: Shāfiʻī, Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥusayn.
al-Dāʻī ilá ashraf al-masāʻī fī ṣifat al-jannah wa-ahlihā wa-mā aʻaddahu Allāh li-ahlihā min al-naʻīm al-muqīm,
Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 40
Origin: Lacks dated colophon ; paper suggests 17th century.
Accompanying materials: Inserts carrying notes (paginated pp.67-68 and pp.109-110).
Former shelfmark: British Museum, London "No. 19. Al-Dai ila ashraf al-masai." ;

Binding: Pasteboards covered in laid paper with dark brown leather over spine, foreedge flap, and edges/turn-ins ; Type II binding (with flap) ; sewn in red thread, two stations ; worked endbands in red and green, poor condition ; overall in poor condition with significant abrasion, losses and lifting of paper and leather, upper and lower covers detaching at spine, delamination of boards, moisture damage, etc.
Support: European laid paper with 8 laid lines per cm. (vertical) ; chain lines spaced roughly 30 mm. apart (horizontal) ; anchor in circle watermark ; quite thick and sturdy ; well-burnished.
Decoration: Section headings, keywords and abbreviation symbols rubricated ; occasional textual dividers in the form of three dots in red.

Script: Naskh ; clear Syrian [?] hand ; virtually serifless ; both lām alif warrāqīyah and lām alif mukhaffafah mursalah used ; descenders mainly tapered and rectilinear ; closed and open counters ; compact in the vertical, with some elongation in the horizontal ; pointing in distinct dots ; even alif maqṣūrah pointed as yāʼ ; occasionally vocalized.
Layout: Written in 23 lines per page ; frame-ruled.

Collation: V-1 (9), 2 V(29), V-1 (38), 2 V(58), V-1 (67), IV-1 (74) ; chiefly quinions ; quire numbering in the form of whole words ("ثاني كراس" etc.) appears on recto of first leaf of each quire ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (includes inserts).
Explicit: "فيقول يا رب الم تغفر لي فيقول بلى بمغفرتي بلغت منزلتك هذه تم الكتاب بحمد الله وعونه وحسن توفيقه وصلى الله على سيدنا محمد واله وصحبه وسلم"

Incipit: "قال الشيخ الامام العالم العلامة شيخ الاسلام فريد عصره شهاب الدين ابو العباس احمد بن الحسين الشافعي امام جامع حمس المحروسة ... الحمد لله الذي اوضح لعباده الصالحين سبل الخير ... وبعد فهذا كتاب سميته الداعي الى اشرف المساعي في صفة الجنة واهلها وما اعده الله من النعيم فيها لخصته من كتاب حادي الارواح الى بلاد الافراح جمع شيخنا الامام العلامة ابي عبد [الله] محمد بن القيم رحمه الله وخلصته من المباحث والاسناد ..."
Title from 'title page' inscription on p.1.

Fine copy of the abridgement of Ibn Qayyim al-Jawzīyah's Hādī al-arwāḥ ilá bilād al-afrāḥ, a description of the inhabitants of Paradise, supplied by his student, Shihāb al-Dīn Abū al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn al-Ḥusayn al-Shāfiʻī, via removal of the isnāds (asānīd). Followed by a treatment for qūbah (skin eruptions or ringworm). Description provided by Maxim Romanov.
Acquired by purchase (funds donated by Horace Rackham).

Bookplate of British Museum, London on upper cover, "British Museum, London. No. 19. Al-Dai ila ashraf al-masai." ; circular seal impression with figure of goat/gazelle in purple ink as well as inscription "599" [?] in Western numerals on 'title page' (p.1) ; former owner's mark appears on 'title page' (p.1) and verso of final leaf (p.152) ; occasional marginal corrections.
الداعي الى أشرف المساعي في صفة الجنة واهلها وما اعده الله لاهلها من النعيم المقيم,
شافعي، شهاب الدين احمد بن الحسين.
